About SAEL
Endeavoring to make a sustainable impact
At SAEL, we strive to provide decarbonisation solutions to
                            facilitate India's adoption of clean and affordable energy projects for baseload power.
                            Our commitment lies in delivering environmentally conscious energy solutions. As
                            one of India's fastest-growing energy companies, we are dedicated to enhancing the
                            energy landscape nationwide.

OUR GOALS
Mission, Vision, & Ethos









Mission
SAEL is committed to reshaping the global energy panorama through scalable and
                                        sustainable solutions. We harness cutting-edge technologies and industry best
                                        practices to
                                        provide dependable and eco-friendly energy solutions, fostering the widespread
                                        adoption of
                                        renewable energy across diverse markets.










Vision
At SAEL, our vision is to spearhead the shift towards a sustainable energy future,
                                        where
                                        renewable sources drive economies and enhance lives. We envision a future where
                                        sustainable energy solutions seamlessly integrate into global infrastructure.
                                    










Ethos
SAEL exemplifies an unwavering dedication to sustainable energy solutions, fueled by
                                        innovation, integrity, and holistic community empowerment. Our principles embody a
                                        culture
                                        of excellence, inclusivity, and accountability, fostering resonance with our global
                                        communities and partners.

SAEL in News












18 May, 2024


SAEL's
                                            Varun Gupta unveils Rs 35,000 crore solar investment plan | ET NOW EXCLUSIVE
                                            INTERVIEW

Ministry of New and Renewable Energy is working towards achieving 500 GW
                                        Non-fossil based electricity generation capacity by the end of this decade. The
                                        move is in line with Prime Minister Narendra Modi's announcement at COP26.

18 Jan, 2024


SAEL's
                                            set to close $1 billion fundraise from foreign, domestic investors

SAEL Ltd, which converts agricultural waste into energy, is close to finalising a
                                        fundraise of $1 billion (about ₹8,300 crore) from US and European investors,
                                        said people aware of the matter.
